intro: Rhododendron eastmanii, commonly known as the Eastman's rhododendron, is a species native to the Himalayas, specifically found in regions of India and Nepal. It is a deciduous shrub that typically grows at high altitudes, often in moist, shaded forest environments. The plant features dense, leathery leaves and produces showy clusters of bell-shaped flowers in shades of pink and white during the spring. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes many other ornamental and ecologically important plants. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and threatened species in its native range.
